intro: Lichtensteinia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have a short, woody stem and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Lichtensteinia species are known for their bright yellow or orange flower heads, which are surrounded by white or pink ray florets. These plants are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
